name: Federation of Western Thrace Turks in Europe
goal:
- To protect and promote the rights of the Turkish community in Western Thrace, Greece and to aid in obtaining solutions for its concerns through democracy and peace.
- As a non-govenmental organisation in Special Consultative Status with the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations (UN ECOSOC), an ordinary member of the Federal Union of European Nationalities (FUEN) and a participating NGO in the Fundamental Rights Platform of FRA, it represents the Turkish community in Western Thrace, Greece before international organizations such as the United Nations, the European Union, the Council of Europe and the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe and lobbying for the solution of its problems.
- Organizing international panel discussions and/or conferences on minority issues, specifically on the problems of the Turkish community in Western Thrace, Greece.
- Carrying out activities aiming at the integration of the emigrant members of the Turkish community in Western Thrace, Greece with the domestic populations and satisfaction of their social needs.
- Publishing newsletters, bulletins, pamphlets, periodicals and reports related to the Turkish community in Western Thrace, Greece and its problems in the languages of Turkish, Greek, English and German.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Borders and Security, Culture, Education and training, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Regional Policy, Youth
euInitiatives:
- Participating non-governmental organization in the Fundamental Rights Platform (FRP) of FRA
- Regular participation in the FRP annual meetings and FRA conferences
- Contributions to the consultations on FRA annual reports, work programmes and multi-annual framework
- Participation in the meetings of the EP Committees and Intergroup for Traditional Minorities, National Communities and Languages
